version_description:
We’re always working on keeping our features up to date so that you get the most from all your workouts. To make sure you never miss an update, go to Settings -> iTunes & App Store -> Automatic Downloads and turn on Updates.

We hope you enjoy!

We’re always working on keeping our features up to date so that you get the most from all your workouts. To make sure you never miss an update, go to Settings -> iTunes & App Store -> Automatic Downloads and turn on Updates.

We hope you enjoy!

-Take photos during a workout without pausing
-Attach photos to workout posts after you're done
-Add a cover photo to show off the best moment

- Fixes to improve the Dashboard, sharing, and overall app experience
- Improved integration with Samsung Gear

- Fixes to improve the Dashboard, sharing, and overall app experience
- Improved integration with Samsung Gear

Saving workouts just got more social:
- Share more of your races and everyday runs with the new photo editor
- Customize your favorite stats on your photos and save or share them
- Post to the community to get cheered on and inspire others to push further

Check out our latest updates!

- Get around easier with new bottom navigation. The 'fan menu' options are now in more convenient places:

- Track Workout is the main, middle option in the nav bar

- Post Status is available on the Activity Feed screen

- Take Photo is now the camera icon in a workout or status post

- Log Workout is available when you visit your list of workouts

- Find Friends is in the last nav bar tab under the menu option 'Friends'

- The new photo editor lets you customize photos with your stats, and save or share them

- New improved workout stats let you see how you did on every mile with easier-to-read charts, including pace and cadence

- The workout display is now more outdoor-friendly with bigger stats

Check out our latest updates!

- Customize the stats you see during workouts by tapping the gear icon

- See all your stats at a glance with auto-scrolling and improved gestures

- Have Under Armour smart shoes? Easily access their data in the new shoe home

- Support for iPhone X

- Improved gestures make it easier to expand stats during a workout

- Enhancements for Under Armour Connected Footwear including new messaging that makes it easy to see the moment your shoes are connected

- Workout Guide for Under Armour Connected Footwear to help you understand your stats and make the most of your workouts

- Apple Watch UX - We reduced the lag experienced on the Apple Watch and fixed a Health app pop up bug.

- Notes can now be edited when you edit your workout

- Delay Start Timer now works while the phone is locked

- A paused or finished workout stays paused/finished when backgrounded

- Recent activity types listed more accurately reflect the most recent activities you've logged

- Reduced crash rate while selecting routes, taking photos, finding friends, checking your notification inbox, viewing challenges

- Photos load faster

- More streamlined navigation and cleaner home screen

- Improved login flow

We're ringing in the new year with our 18.1 release!

- Sharing from UA MapMyRun to your favorite social networks like Facebook and Instagram is now easier using native iOS sharing.

- Under Armour connected footwear users can continue to track workouts with or without their phone and can now see splits for treadmill workouts.

- See your cadence and stride length with the latest Under Armour connected running shoes using HOVR technology—available February 2018.

- Keep an eye out for our new live counter showing how many miles/kilometers the UA community has tracked in 2018!

- Stay tuned: We heard your feedback and will be launching some highly-requested features this spring, including the ability to track GPS workouts phone-free using only Apple Watch.

We're ringing in the new year with our 18.1 release!

- Sharing from UA MapMyRun to your favorite social networks like Facebook and Instagram is now easier using native iOS sharing.

- Under Armour connected footwear users can continue to track workouts with or without their phone and can now see splits for treadmill workouts.

- See your cadence and stride length with the latest Under Armour connected running shoes using HOVR technology—available February 2018.

- Keep an eye out for our new live counter showing how many miles/kilometers the UA community has tracked in 2018!

- Stay tuned: We heard your feedback and will be launching some highly-requested features this spring, including the ability to track GPS workouts phone-free using only Apple Watch.

- You spoke, we listened. The feed will now default to the last tab you visited—Community, Friends, or Me.

- iPhone X UI improvements


For Under Armour Connected Footwear users:

- If you have the latest Connected Footwear shoes with HOVR technology, this release includes periodic coaching tips personalized to you. Keep an eye out for the tips on the detail pages of runs completed with the shoes.

- To prevent unintended or errant data, only workouts longer than two minutes will sync from your shoes to the app.

- Workouts synced from your shoes are now saved according to your default workout sharing privacy setting.

- You can now find and add Under Armour Connected Footwear in Gear Tracker.

This release includes an awesome new feature for workout detail pages, as well as some improvements for the newest version of Under Armour Connected Footwear with HOVR technology.

- GPS-tracked workouts now have a visualized elevation graph that makes it easy to see how the terrain may have affected your splits and other stats. Once you have completed and saved your workout, visit that workout’s detail page to see the new graph.

- Significant improvements for iPhone X display

- For smart shoe users, we've added a new user guide and updated icons to make it easier to see when your shoes are connected.

- This release also contains bug fixes, including a bug related to logging and editing workout calories.
In this release we've improved distance calibration for workouts recorded using the new Under Armour HOVR smart shoes.
This release includes several bug fixes as well as behind-the-scenes improvements to help the app run faster and smoother for you.

In this release, we’ve updated our terms of service, privacy policy, and consents in accordance with new global standards. Just a heads up—you’ll be asked to review these terms before accessing the app. If you have questions or concerns, tap the Help button or any of the Learn More buttons for more information.

Custom workout titles will now display in the activity feed.

For some users, sometimes setting your region would cause an error and not save, but this version has a fix for that problem!

We’ve updated our terms of service, privacy policy, and consents in accordance with new global standards. Just a heads up—you’ll be asked to review these terms before accessing the app. If you have questions or concerns, tap the Help button or any of the Learn More buttons for more information.

Have you ever wondered what your optimal cadence is during a run? Now you can figure it out with your UA HOVR connected footwear! Try out our new cadence calculator to discover your target cadence range for your desired pace.

Hoping to delight the masses with this one - we've improved basic editing and navigation functionality on the logging and editing workout screens! Tapping between fields while the keyboard is expanded, using expected keyboard keys to navigate, and fields staying in view as they're being edited are some basic functionality improvements we made to a screen that probably comes up frequently for most of our users.

We also fixed some high profile bug fixes:
- Connection with MyFitnessPal now works with Facebook
- Improved connection with heart rate monitors
- App no longer freezes when importing multiple shoe workouts

Apple Watch support is here! You can now track workouts with your Apple Watch. Get workout metrics such as distance, duration, speed/pace, and heart rate. Advanced metrics include: run cadence and heart rate-enabled calorie calculations.

To get started: tap the Apple Watch button in “Apps & Devices.” Once the app is installed and permissions are enabled, choose your workout type, tap start, and let the Apple Watch do the rest! All workouts recorded on the Apple Watch will count towards closing your rings.

Additional updates include:
- Improvements to our auto-pause feature.
This release includes several bug fixes as well as behind-the-scenes improvements to help the app run faster and smoother for you.

Our new version has arrived! Check out these updates:

- The Apple Watch experience is outfitted with a fresh new look, complete with new activities to track, including hiking and treadmill workouts!

- Connected footwear users now have access to two new coaching progress graphs. You can now see how your running form varies over the course of your run, relative to target range, and how your running form varies over your last eight eligible coaching runs.

Our new version has arrived! Check out these updates:
- We tuned and primed the app engine for exciting updates to come.

Over the next few weeks you may notice a change in how your calories are calculated. That's because we've improved how we calculate calories based on the recommendations from the Compendium of Physical Activities. We know these calculations are important to you and your goals, and they will reflect a more accurate representation of your caloric burn.

Good news connected footwear users! We're rolling out new banner alerts for personalized stride length and cadence coaching!

Our new version has arrived! Check out these updates:
- We tuned and primed the app engine for exciting updates to come.
We've improved your app experience. This release includes bug fixes, as well as behind-the-scenes improvements to make the app run faster, smoother, and more efficiently.

This release, we're rolling out some exciting updates:
- We are making changes to the pause button to prevent unintentional pausing. This change will be rolling out slowly to all of our users, so if you don’t see it immediately, don’t fret!
- We fixed a bug where the Apple Watch would hang on the loading screen when attempting to sync workout

Here's the list of the exciting features to announce in this update!
- You don't need to be signed up for a race to sign up for a training plan! Along with a design refresh, we're introducing two new training plans: Run to Lose Weight and Learn Running Basics. Pro tip: pairing workouts to your training plan sessions automatically adjusts the mileage goals for the next week.
- Siri Shortcuts are now enabled!
- You can now update your password on the settings page.
- Don't forget to tell your friends "Congrats" when they finish their workout!

Our new version has arrived! Check out these updates:
- We tuned and primed the app engine for exciting updates to come.

It's our first update of 2019! We optimized our app to help keep things running smoothly for the start of the year.
This version also includes support for the latest generation of UA HOVR Connected Footwear

It's our first update of 2019! We optimized our app to help keep things running smoothly for the start of the year.
This version also includes support for the latest generation of UA HOVR Connected Footwear

This release brings enhancements that help you get the most out of your Apple Watch:
- The Activity Selection screen has been redesigned for a more personal experience. Your last five activity types are now displayed so you can easily select them.
- Spin Class and Crossfit are now included in the list of supported activities.
- Swipe left on the Activity Selection screen to see workouts that still need to sync to your phone.
We've also made updates to our UA Connected Footwear experience for easier connection.
This release brings behind the scenes improvements to make the app more stable.
This release brings behind the scenes improvements to make the app more stable.
We've rolled out a brand new feature that allows you to nickname your connected shoe. Have fun with it—make it your own and use emojis!

Over the next few weeks you may notice a change in how your calories are calculated. That's because we've improved how we calculate calories based on the recommendations from the Compendium of Physical Activities. We know these calculations are important to you and your goals, and they will reflect a more accurate representation of your caloric burn.

Good news connected footwear users! We're rolling out new banner alerts for personalized stride length and cadence coaching!

That's because we've improved how we calculate calories based on the recommendations from the Compendium of Physical Activities. We know these calculations are important to you and your goals, and they will reflect a more accurate representation of your caloric burn.

Good news connected footwear users! We're rolling out new banner alerts for personalized stride length and cadence coaching!

Our new version has arrived!
Track what you are doing in the gym or weight room with more detail than ever before. Go to Workout Routines in the ... menu to try it out.
In this release, we fixed a bug to make calories more accurate.
This release brings behind the scenes improvements to make the app more stable.

This release has an exciting announcement and includes behind-the-scenes improvements to make the app more stable.
June 5th is Global Running Day! Go for a run with your friends, your family, or stay on your current training plan and you may just be pleasantly surprised. Get out there and celebrate your health!

Other updates:
* We’ve improved our Apple Watch experience. Workouts recorded from our mobile app are now mirrored more accurately to our Apple Watch app.
* Gym Workouts no longer save to HealthKit as Play!
In this release, we've made bug fixes and improvements to make the app more stable than ever!

In this release: you can now share gym routines with friends and find them in the feed. We've also added many different exercises.

UA HOVR Connected Footwear users can now earn badges based on the various types of workouts you do and how much you run. Try it out and earn those badges!

In this release: you can now share gym routines with friends and find them in the feed. We've also added many different exercises.

UA HOVR Connected Footwear users can now earn badges based on the various types of workouts you do and how much you run. Try it out and earn those badges!

In this release:

Great news, Apple Watch users! You can now receive the true untethered connected footwear experience! On your watch, you'll be able to monitor the connection of your HOVRs, quickly select your activity, start and stop your workout as you please, and view your detailed workout summary—all with greater ease.

In this release:

Under Armour Performance Specialists have written over 10 different workout routines that help you perform at your best. If your goal is to move better, get fit fast, or build a strong core-we have a routine for you. Check it out in the new Explore tab of Workout Routines.

Similarly, we've made Workout Routine discovery easy. Don't know what to do in the gym? Find inspiration from the community by viewing and saving workout routines in the social feed.

We also improved the syncing experience of Apple Watch workouts.

In this release:

Celebrate your accomplishments! Share workout stats online with photos, maps, and routes now.

In this release:

After saving a workout, you'll now see your workout details. You can still access your Activity Feed by tapping on the Feed icon on the far left of the bottom tab bar.

In this release:

We’ve addressed the instability issues associated with iOS 13. You’ll see improvements as we continue to build a better experience for you.

In this release:

We always welcome user feedback and are here to improve your workout experience—you can now save workouts faster and more reliably on the Apple Watch.

Our GPS tracking now provides a higher degree of accuracy.

In this release:

We've made several bug fixes and improvements for a better workout experience.

In this release:

We’ve added Wheelchair as an Activity type and fixed the slight snag about selecting which stats you share on saved workouts.

In this release:

We’ve added Wheelchair as an Activity type and fixed the slight snag about selecting which stats you share on saved workouts.

In this release:

You can now get real-time Form Coaching on your Apple Watch when paired with UA connected footwear. Form Coaching monitors your cadence, alerting you if you fall outside your ideal range. See your cadence as you run and adjust as needed to run efficiently and better manage risk of injury.

In this release:

UA Connected Footwear will now connect more reliably to your Apple Watch. Additionally, you'll now feel a vibration on the Apple Watch screen when you change workout screens.

In this release:

Stay active, no matter where you are, with these free Healthy at Home resources designed for at-home fitness:
- Workout Routine – Mix it up with a collection of workouts designed by UA Performance Specialists that require minimal equipment.

- Training Plan – Train smarter with a custom running plan fit for your exact running level and goals.

- Healthy At Home Challenge – Even though we may not be physically together, we all have the same goal: to stay healthy and to keep others healthy, too. Join the Healthy at Home challenge and log 12 workouts in 30 days! Under Armour will donate up to $1 million to support Good Sports’ efforts in ensuring youth sports leagues have necessary equipment.

In this release:

Celebrate Global Running Day on June 3 with these free resources for at-home fitness #ThroughThisTogether
- Workout Routine – Mix it up with a collection of workouts designed by UA Performance Specialists that require minimal equipment.
- Training Plan – Train smarter with a custom running plan fit for your exact running level and goals.
- Community Challenge – Log 30 miles in 30 days with runners worldwide to celebrate Global Running Day on June 3.

In this release:
We've made a few minor improvements for a better workout experience.

In this release:
- Feel extra Pride in your workout: your path will now show up as a rainbow gradient (instead of a red line).
- We will no longer support iOS 11 or below.

In this release:
Feel extra Pride in your workout: your path will now show up as a rainbow gradient (instead of a red line).
Additionally, if your Apple Watch is paired to UA Connected Footwear, you can now:
- Get real-time Form Coaching, which monitors your cadence, alerting you if you fall outside your ideal range. See your cadence as you run and adjust as needed to run efficiently and better manage risk of injury.
- View your Foot Strike Angle and Ground Contact Time in Workout Details on your iPhone post-workout.

In this release:
You'll now be able to update your email address from within the app.
Check your Garmin-imported runs to see coaching tips for your next workout.

In this release:
Apple Watch users rejoice! Shoe connection is faster and smarter with the ability to connect your shoe in Settings and see which shoe is connected right from the watch.

In this release:
Connected shoe users: before your next workout, check out your pre-workout tip to make sure your next one is better than your last.

In this release:
For all of our athletes on training plans: You can now see your interval splits on your workout details!

In this release:

New for iOS 14 users: Start your workout with a single tap using the MapMy workout widget.

Try out our new voice for real-time Form Coaching!

In this release:

We’ll be removing Nearby Routes and Route Genius from our app as we focus on building new features for our athletes.
